## Natural history notes

Like most millipedes, the Florida Ivory Millipede (Chicobolus spinigerus) has a long, cylindrical body with two pairs of legs per segment. They can get up to 4 inches in length. Their coloration ranges from different shades of browns to bold yellow stripes. When threatened, they will curl up into a spiral.
